title: Remember when AD used to be harder to get than AP?

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
I remember those days well. 
When 300 AD used to be a myth. 
_(and 400 was a boogeyman story you tell your kids around campfires, it never actually existed.)_

Now we live in times where a 4/3/3 Graves has more AD than a 9/5/12 Lux has AP.

Not to mention he also has 50% crit. 
and at certain times Riven had over 600 AD.

Glorious days.

And we wonder why we all get 1-hit all the time?

replies.body: What about the 3/10 Veigar support that presses *R* and one-shots me?
Not going to lie, Veigar anywhere usually leads to problems :S

So, Graves can have a cigar but can't be nerfed properly?

But to be honest, in my experience, AP is the bane of my existence. Give a mage enough AP and they blow up all the squishes from a nice long range.

But still, 300AD with 50% crit is going to be cancerous of course.

Well the whole thing is _(or used to be)_, that mages get lots of AP, but their scalings are less, so you can have 700 AP, but your Q only has a 60% scaling, so you're only doing like 420 damage. 

Meanwhile AD champs had 280ish AD _(which crits for over 500)_, but their scalings are around 100+%.
So their abilities still do decent damage, but their **main** output was auto attacks, and their abilities were there mainly to play around their attacks, (eg. slows/dashes/poke etc).

But now, with 350 AD _(which is mild now for many champs)_ 
Graves's Q does:
100 + (350 - 102 x 0.8) = **299**
200 + (350 - 102 x 1.6) = **397**
**299** + **397** = **696**

Meanwhile Lux's Q with 700 AP does:
250 + (700 x 0.7) = **740**

So Lux's Q does 44 more damage than Graves's Q _(which is nothing in late game)_.
But of course, Lux doesn't crit for 700 with each auto attack...

So you see the damage imbalance when AD champs get so much AD.

If you are going to have a high AA damage cit-focused champion. Don't let their abilities do the same level of damage as someone who is entirely ability focused. It's just common sense to me.

_____

To be clear, I'm not advocating for Lux, I feel dirty playing her she's so strong! 

and I'm certainly not saying AP champions are weak. Im just saying AP champs should get their power from abilities. AD champs should get their power from Autos. _(there are exceptions of course, Talon/Zed are non-crittng ability focused AD champs, while Kayle/Azir are high damaging auto attack focused AP champs.)_ But in general, crit champions like Graves and Lucian and Yi shouldn't have such high damaging ability scalings. Just like AP champs like Veigar and Xerath shouldn't have crits.
